en: [Legal Quits of Claim and Registration Certification] 1814 -1816 [for] James Hamilton of Davidson County, Tennessee and William Anderson of Lexington County Ky

These are three different documents. The first one is dated Dec. 15, 1814, and is written by James Hamilton. It is a quit of claim of the Cherokee/African slaves that his brother in law, Joseph Brown took back from the Cherokee Chief Cotetoy. The slaves were descendents of a slave named Sue that was owned by Hamilton's father in law (Joseph Brown's father), James Brown, and stolen by Cotetoy. The second paper is the registration certification for said quit, written by Joseph Porter in May 1816. The third paper is dated Dec. 15, 1814. It is a quit of claim to two slaves, Jinney and Suey, and offspring, by William Anderson. He also states that Joseph Brown has payed him $150 for the portion of James Brown's estate that Anderson inherited.

It is a quit of claim of the Cherokee/African slaves that his brother in law, Joseph Brown took back from the Cherokee Chief Cotetoy. The slaves were descendents of a slave named Sue that was owned by Hamilton's father in law (Joseph Brown's father), James Brown, and stolen by Cotetoy. The second paper is the registration certification for said quit, written by Joseph Porter in May 1816. The third paper is dated Dec. 15, 1814. It is a quit of claim to two slaves, Jinney and Suey, and offspring, by William Anderson. He also states that Joseph Brown has payed him $150 for the portion of James Brown's estate that Anderson inherited.

No Copyright - United States: The organization that has made the Item available believes that the Item is in the Public Domain under the laws of the United States, but a determination was not made as to its copyright status under the copyright laws of other countries. The Item may not be in the Public Domain under the laws of other countries. Please refer to the organization that has made the Item available for more information.

none: [Legal Quits of Claim and Registration Certification] 1814 -1816 [for] James Hamilton of Davidson County, Tennessee and William Anderson of Lexington County Ky : page 1

body.value: Know all Men by these preasents presents that I James Hamilton of the State of Tennessee and County of Davidson have and by these preasents present quit Claim to Certain Negroes ( Viz Videlicit ) Jinney Suey Jainney Newchous Tannenole Senelaca Dorusendey & Omiah Certain Negroes Recovered by Joseph Brown from the Cherokee Indiens Indians a part of the property taken by said Cherokee Indiens from My father in law James Brown Deceased and as I Neaver Never have Recev.d Received aney any part of Said Estate since the Death of said Deceased and Will Not be accountable for aney Demand against said Estate I therefore quit all Claim to aney part of the said Negroes and Do Warrent Warrant and Defend the same from my Haire or assigne Heir or assignee to the other Ligation of Said Estate as to me or my Haire Heirs Witness my hand & seal 15th December 1814 Test George W Chartton James Hamilton seal Milberry Hamilton Samuel Tarner Acknowledged by James Hamilton July 9th 1815 Joseph B. Porter I was

none: [Legal Quits of Claim and Registration Certification] 1814 -1816 [for] James Hamilton of Davidson County, Tennessee and William Anderson of Lexington County Ky : page 2

body.value: quit Claim of Indian Negroes to Joseph Brown Entired interred

none: [Legal Quits of Claim and Registration Certification] 1814 -1816 [for] James Hamilton of Davidson County, Tennessee and William Anderson of Lexington County Ky : page 3

body.value: State of Tennessee Maury County May Term 1816 when th the within quit claim deed was Exhibited into open Court and the Execution thereof duly proven by the oath of Milberry Hamilton & Subscrybing witness thereto and ordered to be certifiyed certified for rigistration registration Joseph B. Porter

none: [Legal Quits of Claim and Registration Certification] 1814 -1816 [for] James Hamilton of Davidson County, Tennessee and William Anderson of Lexington County Ky : page 4

body.value: Know all Men by these preasents that I William Anderson of the state of Kaintucky Kentucky & County Lexington Do as an Hair Heir of the Estate of James Brown Deceased quit all Claim to two Negro Wemen Women & their family (Viz Jinney & Suey & their offspring unto Joseph Brown and the other ligatures of said Estate as the said Joseph Brown has this Day payed me one Hundred & fifty Dollars it being my proportional part of said Estate the Receipt Whereof is hearby hereby acknowledged Witness My hand and seal 15th December 1814 James Hamilton Wm William Anderson seal Milberry Hamilton
